Package org.neo4j.internal.kernel.api

Interface QueryContext

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AllStoreHolder, Read
    public interface QueryContext
    Represents the specific transactional context in which an index query is executed. Some index implementations, such as the fulltext schema indexes, prefer to take the transaction state into account themselves, rather than relying on the index cursor implementations to do the transaction state filtering.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      static QueryContext NULL_CONTEXT

    • Field Detail

      • NULL_CONTEXT

        static final QueryContext NULL_CONTEXT

    • Method Detail

      • getRead

        Read getRead()
        Get the Read interface to the kernel, which is a view of the store as seen from within the current transaction. This means that store reads through this interface are filtered through the transaction state, if any, of the current transaction.
        Returns:
        a Read instance in the context of the current transaction.

      • cursors

        CursorFactory cursors()
        Returns:
        the CursorFactory associated with the context of this index query.

      • getTransactionStateOrNull

        ReadableTransactionState getTransactionStateOrNull()
        Returns:
        the ReadableTransactionState of the current transaction, if there is any, otherwise null. Note that this will not create any transaction state, if there is none associated with the current transaction.

      • cursorTracer

        PageCursorTracer cursorTracer()
        Returns:
        underlying transaction page cursor tracer

      • memoryTracker

        MemoryTracker memoryTracker()
        Returns:
        underlying transactional memory tracker
